page.title: 14D-Day
page.content: Southwick added further glory to its history by housing Admiral Sir Bertram Ramsey and his staff before and during the Normandy invasion in l944, later becoming General Eisenhower's HQ during D-Day. On the{26th May l943}the codename {OVERLORD}was chosen for the operation of the assault on Europe. General Eisenhower was chosen as the Commander, later joined by General Montgomery and Air Chief Marshal Sir Arthur Tedder. In February l944 Admiral Ramsey issued the outline orders for{OVERLORD}and moved his{HQ {to Southwick House on 26 April l944. Later that year the famous{Wall Map was installed. Eisenhower fixed{D-Day {for the 5 June l944,weather permitting Approx. 27OO vessels took part in the assault on the French coast, carrying troops from many countries.
